title: 100 things to do in Philadelphia
text:
100 things to do in Philadelphia Caption Philadelphia City Hall B. Krist Photo for GPTMC 
Walk through the country's largest municipal building. City Hall on Center Square contains 14.5 acres of floor space with lavish public rooms and an exterior to match. The tower is the tallest masonry structure in the world without a steel frame. Greater Philadelphia Tourism Marketing Corp. 
Walk through the country's largest municipal building. City Hall on Center Square contains 14.5 acres of floor space with lavish public rooms and an exterior to match. The tower is the tallest masonry structure in the world without a steel frame. Greater Philadelphia Tourism Marketing Corp. (B. Krist Photo for GPTMC) Caption Liberty Bell Center David Swanson / MCT 
Let freedom ring! You can't visit Philly without stopping at the most famous cracked bell of all time, the Liberty Bell, located at the Liberty Bell Center . The experience includes a video presentation and exhibits. 
Let freedom ring! You can't visit Philly without stopping at the most famous cracked bell of all time, the Liberty Bell, located at the Liberty Bell Center . The experience includes a video presentation and exhibits. (David Swanson / MCT) See more galleries 
While you're in Philadelphia to check out the Ravens, here are some places to add to your itinerary. The City of Brotherly Love, less than a two-hour drive from Baltimore, has a proud history and a transformative spirit that makes it a perfect destination for all ages. Here's our list of 100 things to do. For more information on visiting Philadelphia, go to VisitPhilly . This photo gallery is featured in these articles:
